KCLInput Class Reference

provide an object that represent an input. This is the class mother of all device you want to use. It return you all information about the device, for example the name. And it return the status of the device, it means the type, code, and value. More...

#include <Gluon/KCL/KCLInput>

Detailed Description

provide an object that represent an input. This is the class mother of all device you want to use. It return you all information about the device, for example the name. And it return the status of the device, it means the type, code, and value.

Author:
sacha schutz <istdasklar@gmail.com>

Creating a KCLInput

The easiest way to create usable KCLInput is to set it by the evdev file name. 
 KCLInput * myInput  = new KCLInput("/dev/input/event2");
 kDebug()<<myInput->name();

Member Function Documentation

bool KCLInput::anyMove (  )  [inline]

Returns:
true if a motion is done by a motion input.( mouse , joystick ...) 
 KCLInput * myInput = new KCLInput("/dev/input/event3");
 if ( myInput->anyMove()) kDebug()<<"you have move something...";
See also:
KCLInputEvent

bool KCLInput::anyPress (  )  [inline]

Returns:
true if a button is pressed. 
 KCLInput * myInput = new KCLInput("/dev/input/event3");
 if ( myInput->anyPress()) kDebug()<<"you have press on something...";
See also:
KCLInputEvent

int KCLInput::axisAbsolu ( int  code  )  [inline]

Returns:
the axis Absolute value. This is an absolue value. For example the Joystick return an absolu position.
See also:
KCLInputEvent

AbsVal KCLInput::axisCapability ( int  axisCode  )  [inline]

Returns:
the axis capability..This is usefull to know the capability of a joystick .
See also:
KCLInputEvent

int KCLInput::axisPosition ( int  code  )  [inline]

Returns:
the axis position. This is a relativ value. For example the mouse return a relativ position.
See also:
KCLInputEvent

unsigned int KCLInput::bustype (  )  [inline]

Returns:
the bus of the device

bool KCLInput::button ( int  code  )  [inline]

Returns:
true if the button with code is pressed. Otherwise it return false 
 KCLInput * myInput = new KCLInput("/dev/input/event3");
 if ( myInput->button(LeftBtn)) kDebug()<<"clicked";
See also:
KCLInputEvent

QList<int> KCLInput::buttonCapabilities (  )  [inline]

Returns:
a list of capability button input. For example the mouse will return a list with LeftBtn,RightBtn ....
See also:
KCLInputEvent

DEVICE KCLInput::deviceType (  )  [inline]

Returns:
the device Type. KCL_KEYBOARD,KCL_MOUSE,KCL_JOYSTICK,KCL_TABLET,KCL_TOUCHPAD,KCL_UNKNOWN;
See also:

bool KCLInput::error (  )  [inline]

void KCLInput::inputEventFilter ( KCLInputEvent *  event  )  [virtual]

this function can be reimplemented to customize the event Loop. 

 void MyInput::inputEventFilter(KCLInputEvent * event)
    *{
 switch ( event->type())
    *{
    *case EV_KEY : //do something....
    *}
    *}
 if ( myInput->anyMove()) kDebug()<<"you have move something...";
See also:
KCLInputEvent
